title: to try
content:
paste - merge lines of files

join - join lines of two files on a common field

title: ffmpeg
content:
Reencode video:

 

ffmpeg -an -i test.mov -f mov -vcodec rawvideo -pix_fmt rgb24 mmi-disgust.mov

 

Camshot:

 

ffmpeg -f video4linux2 -r 25 -t 1 -i /dev/video0 -f image2 test.jpg

 

Make video out of images:

 

ffmpeg -f image2 -pix_fmt yuvj420p -i frame_%03d.jpg -f mov -vcodec rawvideo -pix_fmt rgb24  frames.mov

ffmpeg -f image2 -pix_fmt yuvj420p -i S999/001/S999_001_00000%03d.png -f mov -vcodec mpeg1video -pix_fmt rgb24  frames.mpg 

 

Capture webcam:

 

ffmpeg -an -f video4linux2 -vcodec mjpeg -r 5 -b 200000 -t 20 -s 320x240 -i /dev/video0 -f mov -vcodec rawvideo -pix_fmt rgb24 me.mov

ffmpeg -i me.mov -f image2 %03d.jpg

 

 

Re-encode matroska file:

ffmpeg -i Tekkonkinkreet.2006.720p.BluRay.x264-SiNNERS.mkv -vn -acodec copy sound.ac3

ffmpeg -i sound.ac3 -acodec libmp3lame -ab 160k -ac 2 sound.mp3

ffmpeg -y -sameq -i Tekkonkinkreet.2006.720p.BluRay.x264-SiNNERS.mkv -i sound.mp3 -vcodec libxvid Tekkonkinkreet.2006.720p.BluRay.x264-SiNNERS.avi

 

 

 

Speed up video:

ffmpeg -sameq -i empathic-1.ogv -r 16 -vf setpts=0.0625*PTS -an Output.mp4

title: du
content:
Find biggest

 

Find biggest older than 3 months files:

 

find /disk1/b3data/tomcat/webapps/weborb/upload/ -atime +90 -type f -printf "%kKB \t %100p \t\t %AY-%Am-%Ad \n" | sort -n | tail -n 800 > ~/disk1-upload-biggest-oldest.txt

Find files larger than 5MB:

find /usr/share/wallpapers/ -size +5M

title: ssh
content:
Tunneling stuff:

ssh -L 33061:localhost:3306 root@unistud.asteasolutions.net -p 22816

 

Open remote X's applications locally:

 ssh -X unistud.asteasolutions.net -p 22802 -l root "VirtualBox"

ssh -Y -l root -p 22812 r2d2.asteasolutions.net -X /extension_hd/jprobe/jsonde-1.0.0.beta7/jsonde.sh

 

Reverse tunnel:

ssh -R 2000:localhost:22 user@remoteserver

 

Proxy:

ssh -D1080 -oControlMaster=no symkat@symkat.com

title: gcc
content:
Create assembly listing:

 

gcc -c -g -Wa,-a,-ahl=somefile.s [[any other options you need]] somefile.c

title: awk
content:
awk '/DSSIM Index: / { print $3}'

 

awk 'match($0,"publication/([^\"]*png)",arr) {print arr[1]}

 

pwd | awk -F "/" 'n=split($0,arr) {print arr[n]}'

 

Find the minimum of the third column of a file

awk -F" " 'BEGIN{min = 10000} {min = min > $3 ? $3 : min} END{print min}'

title: mysql
content:
select * from PagesElement,ProjectsPage where ProjectsPage.fkProjectId = 4943 AND ProjectsPage.fkPageId = PagesElement.fkPageId and PagesElement.attributes not like "%<linkURL>%</linkURL>%" AND PagesElement.attributes like "%<linkType>linkToURL</linkType>%";

 

mysqldump b3db --routines --comments > b3dbdump.sql -uroot -p

mysqldump b3db --routines  --comments -uroot -p | bzip2 > b3dbdump-2011-07-08.sql.bz2

 

select replace(xml,"CFF<","<") from Page where id=13547 and xml COLLATE utf8_bin like "%CFF%";

 

update Page set xml=(replace(xml,"CFF","")) where xml COLLATE utf8_bin like "%CFF<%";

 

 

Mysql client commands:

  • status
  • show full processlist

title: books
content:
Technical

 

* Conceptual Blockbusting

* The productive programmer by Neal Ford

* User stories applied

* Patterns of Enterprise Application Architecture

* Analysis Patterns: Reusable Object Models

* The pragmatic programmer - from journeyman to master

Elements of Style by William Strunk Jr. and E.B. White

* Masterminds of programming

Object-Oriented Reengineering Patterns

Refactoring to patterns

* How to solve it, George Polya

* JLS

The Art of Computer Programming

* Software Configuration Management Patterns, Steve Berczuk

* A Pattern Language: Towns, Buildings, Construction, Christopher Alexander

Design and Use of Software Architectures: Adopting and Evolving a Product-Line Approach, Jan Bosch

Software Architecture for Product Families: Principles and Practice, Mehdi Jazayeri

* Hacker's delight, 2nd edition, Henry S. Warren

* Hackers and painters

* Martin, Robert C. Agile Software Development (Principles, Patterns, and Practices). 

Pramod Saldage and Martin Fowler, NoSQL Distilled

* Brian Fitzpatrick and Ben Collins-Sussman, Team Geek

Jeff Gothelf with Josh Seiden, Lean UX

* Peopleware

* Brian P. Hogan, tmux: Productive Mouse-Free Development

* Drew Neil, Practical Vim: Edit Text at the Speed of Thought

Linda Lamb, Learning the Vi and Vim Editors

Michal Zalewski, The Tangled Web: A Guide to Securing Modern Web Applications

Dominic Barnes, Node Security

Operating Systems Design and Implementation (3rd Edition) Hardcover – January 14, 2006 by Andrew S Tanenbaum



Code complete 1st edition:

* The Psychology of Computer Programming, Gerald Weinberg

* Programming pearls, Jon Bentley

Classics in software engineering, Ed Yourdon

Principles of software engineering management, Tom Gilb

? Structured Design, Yourdon and Constantine

The art of software testing, Glenford Myers

Software engineering economics, Barry Boehm

The art of computer programming, Donald Knuth

Wicked problems, Righteous solutions, DeGrace and Stahl

 

Code complete 2nd edition:

* Pragmatic Programmer (Hunt and Thomas 2000)

* Jon Bentley’s Programming Pearls, 2d Ed (Bentley 2000)

Kent Beck’s Extreme Programming Explained: Embrace Change

Writing Solid Code – Microsoft’s Techniques for Developing Bug-Free C Software (Maguire 1993)

The Practice of Programming by Brian Kernighan and Rob Pike

Programmers at Work by Susan Lammers

Overview Material:

* Robert L. Glass’s Facts and Fallacies of Software Engineering (2003)

Professional Sofware Development (2004), Steve McConnell

The Swebok: Guide to the Software Engineering Body of Knowledge (Abran 2001)

* Gerald Weinberg’s The Psychology of Computer Programming (Weinberg 1998)

Software Creativity (Glass 1995)

Software Engineering Overview:

Roger S. Pressman’s Software Engineering: A Practitioner’s Approach, 6th Ed. (Pressman 2004)

ACM Computing Reviews

Construx Software’s Professional Development Ladder (www.construx.com/ladder/)

 

 

Martin Gardner:

Aha! Insight

Aha! Gotcha

My Best Mathematical and Logical Puzzles

Perplexing Puzzles and Tantalizing Teasers

Hexaflexagons and other Mathematical Diversions


 Business Adventures, by John Brooks http://www.gatesnotes.com/Books/Business-Adventures


Fictional

 

La mechanique du coeur

title: screen
content:
Detach a session:

$ screen <command>

Ctrl-A D

 

Share session: (have to be logged as same user)

(on first terminal)

$ screen -S foo

(on second terminal)

$ screen -x foo

JavaScript

EclEmma - test coverage plugin for Eclipse

ConTest - Java multithreading instrumentation

mockito - http://code.google.com/p/mockito/

fest (fixtures for easy software testing) - GUI testing

selenium - web testing automation

Cucumber - behaviour driven development (http://cukes.info)

Watir

http://java.dzone.com/articles/reverse-engineer-source-code-u

title: git
content:
git svn init svn://asteasolutions.net/b3

git svn fetch

 

 

svn export equivalent:

git clone https://github.com/organicinternet/magento-configurable-simple tmp

cd tmp

git archive master | tar -x -C ../magento-configurable-simple

 

reset remote tracking branch:

git checkout live
git fetch
git reset origin/live

unindex a file:

git update-index --assume-unchanged start
git update-index --no-assume-unchanged start


restrict upstream branches:

git config push.default upstream

title: delete file by inode

stat file to get inode
  or
ls -il filename
  then

title: McConnell's reading plan
content:
Introductory Level
* Adams, James L. Conceptual Blockbusting: A Guide to Better Ideas, 4th ed. Cambridge, Mass.: Perseus Publishing.
* Bentley, Jon. Programming Pearls, 2d Ed. Reading, Mass.: Addison-Wesley, 2000.
* Glass, Robert L. Facts and Fallacies of Software Engineering, Boston, Mass.: Addison Wesley, 2003.
* McConnell, Steve. Software Project Survival Guide. Redmond, WA: Microsoft Press, 1998.
McConnell, Steve. Code Complete, 2d Ed.. Redmond, WA: Microsoft Press, 2004.

 

Practitioner Level

Berczuk, Stephen P. and Brad Appleton. Software Configuration Management
Patterns: Effective Teamwork, Practical Integration, Boston, Mass.: AddisonWesley, 2003.
Fowler, Martin. UML Distilled: A Brief Guide to the Standard Object Modeling Language, 3d Ed, Boston, Mass.: Addison Wesley, 2003.
Glass, Robert L. Software Creativity, Reading, Mass.: Addison Wesley, 1995.
Kaner, Cem, Jack Falk, Hung Q. Nguyen. Testing Computer Software, 2d Ed., New York: John Wiley & Sons, 1999.
Larman, Craig. Applying UML and Patterns: An Introduction to Object-Oriented Analysis and Design and the Unified Process, 2d Ed., Englewood Cliffs, N.J.:
Prentice Hall, 2001. McConnell, Steve. Rapid Development. Redmond, WA: Microsoft Press, 1996.
Wiegers, Karl. Software Requirements, 2d Ed. Redmond, WA: Microsoft Press, 2003.
"Manager’s Handbook for Software Development", NASA Goddard Space Flight Center. Downloadable from sel.gsfc.nasa.gov/website/documents/online-doc.htm

 

Professional Level

Bass, Len, Paul Clements, and Rick Kazman. Software Architecture in Practice, Second Edition, Boston, Mass.: Addison Wesley, 2003.
* Fowler, Martin. Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code, Reading, Mass.: Addison Wesley, 1999.
Gamma, Erich, et al. Design Patterns, Reading, Mass.: Addison Wesley, 1995.

Gilb, Tom. Principles of Software Engineering Management. Wokingham, England: Addison-Wesley.
Maguire, Steve. Writing Solid Code. Redmond, WA: Microsoft Press, 1993.
Meyer, Bertrand. Object-Oriented Software Construction, 2d Ed. New York: Prentice Hall PTR, 1997.
“Software Measurement Guidebook”, NASA Goddard Space Flight Center. Available from sel.gsfc.nasa.gov/website/documents/online-doc.htm.

McConnell's reading plan
